channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 5 Big Takeaways From This Earnings Season
item.description: Quarterly earnings are on pace to leap ahead for companies in the S&P 500, while revenue underperforms—a scenario that suggests cost-cutting, and not performance, are the driver of recent profits.

item.title: ‘She’s now down to her last few dollars’: My friend quit her job, blew her inheritance and will take vacations using credit cards. Will she ever see sense?
item.description: “She has over $70,000 in her retirement fund, but says that’s for emergencies.”

item.title: AI Is About to Boost Power Bills---Who'll Take Heat for That?
item.description: High prices are a windfall for power plant owners but are starting to raise difficult questions.

item.title: 10-, 30-year Treasury yields finish lower for second day as Israeli military goes on high alert
item.description: Yields on U.S. government debt closed lower on Monday as traders watched the latest developments in the Middle East and looked ahead to a busy week of U.S. economic updates.

item.title: Investors Borrowed Like Crazy During the Rally. Now They're Paying the Price.
item.description: Behind the market tumult of the past month: the rapid unwind of several popular trades and the heavy use of leverage

item.title: How Robinhood can win a bigger piece of the $65 trillion pie of investable assets
item.description: Piper Sandler sees Robinhood as well positioned to benefit from the generational wealth transfer — and a new web platform that could broaden its appeal.

item.title: How Bank of America Ignores Its Own Rules to Prevent Dangerous Workloads
item.description: The death of a former Green Beret sparks an outcry about the all-nighters and 100-hour weeks that grind down young investment bankers.

item.title: What history says could happen next after volatility roiled the stock market
item.description: Rising volatility in the stock market could potentially trigger a “regime” change in market sentiment, says one analyst.

item.title: I'm 37 Years Old, and I Haven't Saved Nearly Enough for Retirement. What Do I Do?
item.description: Like so many millennials, I started saving late, and catching up hasn’t been easy.

item.title: Don’t expect inflation to take a turn for the worse in PPI and CPI reports
item.description: The rate of inflation probably rose a bit faster in July than in June, but not enough to set off alarm bells or alter a clear slowdown in price increases. The Federal Reserve is likely to remain on track to cut interest rates next month.
